caption.title: Climate trajectories for Yellowstone National Park USA.
caption.p: Forward ( a) and reverse ( b) climate trajectories for Yellowstone National Park (red polygon) for the period 1995–2085. Forward trajectories depict routes that minimize the cumulative exposure (MCE) to dissimilar isotherms along paths between a source pixel and its future climate analogue (dot). Forward trajectories ( sensu ‘forward velocity' 4 11) characterize the potential exposure of organisms to climate change. Reverse climate trajectories depict paths with the lowest MCE between a future cell and an analogue under current climate conditions (dot). Reverse trajectories ( sensu ‘reverse velocity' 4 11) characterize how climatically accessible a site is to colonization from other sites. Climate trajectories (forward and reverse) can be characterized by minimum exposure distance (MED), velocity MED (length/time), and MCE.
